alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:54PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Montezuma County through 230 PM MDT... At 154 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dolores, or 34 miles west of Durango, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cortez around 210 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 31. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 36 and 52. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
